subject: [Action Required] Inform your customers about the upgrade from Google Hangouts to Google Chat
preview: Google Hangouts on web will redirect to Google Chat on web starting November 1, 2022.    On November 1, 2022, we'll enter the last phase of the Google Hangouts upgrade to Google Chat. Your customers c

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Google Hangouts on web will redirect to Google Chat on web starting November 1, 2022.
On November 1, 2022, we'll enter the last phase of the Google Hangouts upgrade to Google Chat. Your customers cannot opt out of this change.

Dear Partner,

We're writing to let you know that starting November 1, 2022, Google Hangouts on web will begin redirecting to Google Chat on web, after which Hangouts will no longer be available.

For some of your customers' users, some conversations or portions of conversations won't migrate from Hangouts to Chat.

What does this mean for my customers?

In February 2022, we announced that we would make Google Chat the default chat application by turning on the "Chat preferred" setting for any customers who hadn't already done so.

Since March 2022, Hangouts mobile apps, Hangouts in Gmail web, and the Hangouts Chrome extension have been redirecting to Chat. Starting November 1, 2022, visiting Hangouts on web will redirect you to Chat on web. This change is not optional.

Note: Hangouts on web and users' conversations there will remain accessible until November 1, 2022.

Here are some additional changes your customers can expect as part of this update:

  • Searching for Hangouts and Chat messages in Gmail
    • Currently, when a Gmail user performs a search, they find results for Hangouts and Chat messages in two places-under the Mail tab and under the Messages tab (previously displayed as Chat & Spaces tab).
      Starting November 1, 2022, Gmail users will only find results for Hangouts and Chat messages under the Messages tab (previously displayed as Chat & Spaces tab).
      After January 1, 2023, all Hangouts and Chat search results will be removed from the Mail tab in Gmail. However, any messages under Vault retention or holds will continue to be available for admins in Vault.

  • Exporting Hangouts and Chat data
    • Currently, Hangouts and Chat messages are available in the Data Export Tools for Hangouts, Chat, and Gmail (for admins).
      • If your organization uses Vault, you can find and export Hangouts and Chat messages in Vault search results for Hangouts, Chat, and Gmail.
    • Starting November 1, 2022, interoperability between Hangouts and Chat will be turned down. As a result, new Chat messages will no longer be available in the Data Export Tools for Hangouts and Gmail. They will only be available in the Data Export Tool for Chat.
      • If your organization uses Vault, starting November 1, 2022, we recommend searching for Hangouts and Chat messages under Chat only.
    • After January 1, 2023, Hangouts data will be deleted. Hangouts and Chat messages will no longer be available in the Data Export Tools for Hangouts and Gmail. Old Hangouts data that is already available in Chat, will be available in the Data Export Tool for Chat.
      • If your organization uses Vault, starting January 1, 2023, you'll no longer see Hangouts and Chat messages if you search under Hangouts or Gmail-unless those messages are under a retention or hold. We recommend searching for Hangouts and Chat messages under Chat.

  • Other changes
    • Data Export Tool: Starting January 1, 2023, customers won't be able to use the Data Export Tool to download Hangouts data and users will no longer be able to use Hangouts Takeout. Note that Data Export Tool for Chat for Google Chat does not include user's messages from group conversations created by users from other organizations.
    • Gmail API: Starting November 1, 2022, the Gmail API will no longer produce new Chat messages.
    • Apps Monthly Uptime Dashboard: The Apps Monthly Uptime Dashboard will not list Hangouts starting November 1, 2022.
    • Domain Transfer: Starting January 1, 2023, Hangouts data will be unsupported for Domain Transfer.

What do I need to do?

We've contacted your affected customers about this change. To better prepare your customers for this change, we recommend taking the following actions as soon as possible:

  • Carefully review the notification we sent to your customers (copied below). It includes additional details and recommended actions.
  • Follow up with your customers to provide additional support as needed.
  • Advise your customers that, if they wish to keep Hangouts conversations, they should export their organization's data and/or enable their users to use Google Takeout to download Hangouts data before January 1, 2023, when Hangouts data will be deleted.

Thanks for choosing Google Workspace.

- The Google Workspace Team

Here is the notification we sent to your affected customers:

On November 1, 2022, we'll enter the last phase of the Google Hangouts upgrade to Google Chat. You cannot opt out of this change.

Dear Administrator,

We're writing to let you know that starting November 1, 2022, Google Hangouts on web will begin redirecting to Google Chat on web and Hangouts will no longer be available.

For some users, some conversations or portions of conversations won't migrate from Hangouts to Chat. The list of users for whom some conversation(s) or portions of conversations won't be migrated is attached to this email.

What does this mean for my organization?

In February 2022, we announced that we would make Google Chat the default chat application by turning on the "Chat preferred" setting for any customers who hadn't already done so.

Since March 2022, Hangouts mobile apps, Hangouts in Gmail web, and the Hangouts Chrome extension have been redirecting to Chat. Starting November 1, 2022, visiting Hangouts on web will redirect you to Chat on web. This change is not optional.

Note: Hangouts on web and users' conversations will remain accessible until November 1, 2022.

Here are some additional changes you can expect as part of this update:

  • Searching for Hangouts and Chat messages in Gmail
    • Currently, when a Gmail user performs a search, they find results for Hangouts and Chat messages in two places-under the Mail tab and under the Messages tab (previously displayed as Chat & Spaces tab).
      Starting November 1, 2022, Gmail users will only find results for Hangouts and Chat messages under the Messages tab (previously displayed as Chat & Spaces tab).
      After January 1, 2023, all Hangouts and Chat search results will be removed from the Mail tab in Gmail. However, any messages under Vault retention or holds will continue to be available for admins in Vault.

  • Exporting Hangouts and Chat data
    • Currently, Hangouts and Chat messages are available in the Data Export Tools for Hangouts, Chat, and Gmail (for admins).
      • If your organization uses Vault, you can find and export Hangouts and Chat messages in Vault search results for Hangouts, Chat, and Gmail.
    • Starting November 1, 2022, interoperability between Hangouts and Chat will be turned down. As a result, new Chat messages will no longer be available in the Data Export Tools for Hangouts and Gmail. They will only be available in the Data Export Tool for Chat.
      • If your organization uses Vault, starting November 1, 2022, we recommend searching for Hangouts and Chat messages under Chat only.
    • After January 1, 2023, Hangouts data will be deleted. Hangouts and Chat messages will no longer be available in the Data Export Tools for Hangouts and Gmail. Old Hangouts data that is already available in Chat, will be available in the Data Export Tool for Chat.
      • If your organization uses Vault, starting January 1, 2023, you'll no longer see Hangouts and Chat messages if you search under Hangouts or Gmail-unless those messages are under a retention or hold. We recommend searching for Hangouts and Chat messages under Chat.

  • Other changes
    • Data Export Tool: Starting January 1, 2023, customers won't be able to use the Data Export Tool to download Hangouts data and users will no longer be able to use Hangouts Takeout.
      Data Export Tool for Chat for Google Chat does not include user's messages from group conversations created by users from other organizations.
    • Gmail API: Starting November 1, 2022, the Gmail API will no longer produce new Chat messages.
    • Apps Monthly Uptime Dashboard: The Apps Monthly Uptime Dashboard will not list Hangouts starting November 1, 2022.
    • Domain Transfer: Starting January 1, 2023, Hangouts data will be unsupported for Domain Transfer.

What do I need to do?

If you wish to keep a copy of Hangouts conversations, we strongly encourage you to export your organization's data and/or enable your users to use Google Takeout to download Hangouts data before January 1, 2023, when Hangouts data will be deleted.

Inform your users that starting November 1, 2022, they will no longer be able to access Hangouts and will be redirected to Google Chat.

Note: This only applies for users who are still accessing Hangouts on the web, particularly users listed on the attachment.

Thanks for choosing Google Workspace.

-The Google Workspace Team


We've identified your customers affected by this issue below:
